revised_title: Spatial and Temporal Response Properties of Residual Vision in Hemianopia
tldr: The study investigates the spatial and temporal response properties of residual vision in a patient with hemianopia, caused by damage to the primary visual cortex. Two distinct channels mediating residual vision are discovered: one responds to spatial structure, and the other to light flux changes. The study also measures the amount of light scatter in the eye and concludes that scattered light cannot account for the results obtained with the stimuli used to characterize the residual vision of the patient.
